Year / Title: CoxNAM: An interpretable deep survival analysis model
Objectives / Goals: Build a nonlinear survival model compatible with Cox’s partial likelihood, improve predictive ranking performance compared to CPH, RSF, DeepSurv, provide intrinsic interpretability through NAM shape functions.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, missing Uno's CI for valid under indep. cens.

Year / Title: SurvivalGAN: Generating Time-to-Event Data for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Formalize synthetic survival data generation, generate time-to-event data that incorporates censored and uncensored data, evaluate quality of generated data
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE error, missing Uno's CI for valid under indep. cens.

Year / Title: Sparse and Hierarchical Transformer for Survival Analysis on Whole Slide Images
Objectives / Goals: Show better survival prediction than baselines, and outperform SOTA based on C-index.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, cens. assumptions not checked, no use of IPCW

Year / Title: Explainable survival analysis with uncertainty using convolution-involved vision transformer
Objectives / Goals: Improve survival risk ranking using integrative deep model; stratify patients
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, CI matches goal, but cens. assumptions not addressed

Year / Title: Interpretable Survival Analysis for Heart Failure Risk Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Predict incident heart failure risk using censored EHR time-to-event data, provide an interpretable survival model using EBMs, deliver accurate survival predictions compared with Cox and other survival models.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, AUC fits discrimination goal, IBS partially covers calibration, uses IPCW

Year / Title: Survival Analysis for Multimode Ablation Using Self-Adapted Deep Learning Network Based on Multisource Features
Objectives / Goals: Rank patients by risk (high- vs low-risk stratification, inferred via risk scores and KM split), predict individual survival curves (time-dependent PFS probability), assess calibration clinically (qualitative comparison of predicted vs actual recurrence times).
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, Antollini CI unstable with heavy censoring, no MAE/RMSE or TD-AUC, IBS alone is insufficient. Missing calibration metrics

Year / Title: A boosting first-hitting-time model for survival analysis in high-dimensional settings
Objectives / Goals: Develop non-PH model to predict first hitting time, evaluate predictive performance and calibration, no ranking.
Metrics Used: Brier Score, IBS, KM calibrations plots
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, Brier score + IBS are appropriate, no ranking (which matches objective), censoring partially assessed; censoring assumptions not validated

Year / Title: Exploiting Censored Information in Self-Training for Time-to-Event Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event (survival time) and improve accuracy using a semi-supervised approach that uses censored observations more effectively, develop a self-training framework (STUART) that augments training data with confident predictions on censored instances, compare predictive performance against RSF, Cox-based models, and SP-AFT
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, only use C-index. No calibration; censoring bias unaddressed

Year / Title: Differentiable Sorting for Censored Time-to-Event Data
Objectives / Goals: Improve risk ranking performance over CoxPH, handle censoring properly, enable top-k risk prediction
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, C-index matches ranking goal. But they use Harrell's, when their datasets include heavy censoring (~85%). No justification of independent censoring. No censoring-robust alternatives.

Year / Title: MOTOR: a time-to-event foundation model for structured medical records
Objectives / Goals: Predict the full time-to-event (TTE) distribution. Improve discrimination, calibration
Metrics Used: TD-C, Harrell C, IBS, ND calibration
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, discrimination & calibration metrics match some goals, but they do not evaluate time-to-event accuracy (no MAE/RMSE/Hinge/Margin/PO), despite explicitly claiming to predict TTE

Year / Title: Improve survival prediction accuracy, improve risk ranking,
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event OS using radiomic + clinical features, identify strong preprocessing / feature selection / ML combinations, stratify patients into risk groups (Kaplan–Meier used for validation).
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, Harrell’s CI measures risk ranking, but no IBS, MAE, RMSE, or other time-error metrics are reported.

Year / Title: Understanding the Impact of Competing Events on Heterogeneous Treatment Effect Estimation from Time-to-Event Data
Objectives / Goals: Analyze how competing events induce covariate shift for different causal estimands,
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, RMSE of estimated HTEs is the correct metric for their causal-identification goals.

Year / Title: Predicting the Risk of Posttraumatic Osteoarthritis After Primary Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction: A Machine Learning Time-to-Event Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event outcomes, generate individualized survival curves, identify risk factors, compare RSF to KM
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics do not fully address time-to-event prediction, and censoring handling is incomplete (Harrell CI bias)

Year / Title: Fair Survival Time Prediction via Mutual Information Minimization
Objectives / Goals: Ensure fairness of survival-time predictions across sensitive groups, measure disparities in survival prediction
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, Brier/IBS, ECE, disparity metrics
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, correct for fairness objective, but C-index not censoring-robust

Year / Title: Using Bayesian Neural Networks to Select Features and Compute Credible Intervals for Personalized Survival Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Accurate selection of pertinent features, computation of trustworthy credible intervals (uncertainty), precise estimation of event times or risk scores
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, objective metrics correct, but censoring handling incomplete (Harrell CI bias)

Year / Title: Survival Analysis of Breast Cancer Patients: A Population-Based Study from SEER
Objectives / Goals: Predict risk of death, identify significant prognostic features, compare RSF to Cox and Gradient Boosting on predictive performance (predicting ranking, survivability)
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, only ranking is evaluated, even though they imply broader prediction goals + incorrect censoring handling

Year / Title: Survival Analysis for Multimode Ablation Using Self-Adapted Deep Learning Network Based on Multisource Features
Objectives / Goals: Benchmark predictive performance of survival models
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, correct metrics for objective, but censoring handling incomplete

Year / Title: CVaDeS: A Conditional Variational Deep Survival Model for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict risk; evaluate feature selection; model uncertainty
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, partial alignment with objectives + incorrect censoring handling

Year / Title: Deep Survival Analysis and Counterfactual Inference Using Balanced Representations
Objectives / Goals: Estimate ATE/ITE under censoring; reduce confounding; improve causal accuracy
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, causal metrics correct, but censoring handling incomplete (Harrell CI)

Year / Title: Federated Survival Forests
Objectives / Goals: Provide an efficient, federated survival model, achieve strong discrimination performance, achieve good calibration of survival probabilities, and handle censored, incomplete data across distributed clients.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, Missing TTE accuracy + full calibration metrics, but censoring handled correctly

Year / Title: Exploiting Censored Information in Self-Training for Time-to-Event Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Predict survival time, exploit censored data, improve TTE accuracy
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE error + calibration; Harrell CI invalid under heavy censoring (over 70%)

Year / Title: Tabular GAN-Based Oversampling of Imbalanced Time-to-Event Data for Survival Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Evaluate whether GAN-based oversampling improves balanced survival prediction, assess impacts on survival-prediction performance.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE error + calibration; censoring handled incorrectly

Year / Title: Deep Clustering Survival Machines with Interpretable Expert Distributions
Objectives / Goals: Perform time-to-event prediction, perform survival clustering using interpretable expert distributions, compete with state-of-the-art deep methods (Deep Cox, DSM, SCA, VaDeSC), show that the mixture-of-experts formulation improves interpretability.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics + missing calibration, incorrect censoring handling

Year / Title: Uncertainty Estimation in Deep Bayesian Survival Models
Objectives / Goals: Assess whether Bayesian NNs improve survival prediction under Cox PH, quantify uncertainty, compare deterministic vs Bayesian models on predictive performance.
Metrics Used: Harrell C-index, Uno C-index, IBS, NLL
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, metrics align with objectives and appropriately handle censoring

Year / Title: Prognosis of fall risk in home care clients: A noninvasive approach using survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict individual fall risk within 6 months, provide a ranking of individuals, predict time-to-event, provide calibrated survival curves for decision support.
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, Uno CI, IBS, MAE-Hinge, D-Calib
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, ranking, TTE accuracy, and calibration are all evaluated properly. Uno CI, IBS (IPCW), MAE-Hinge, and D-Calib used appropriately

Year / Title: Efficient Training of Probabilistic Neural Networks for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Compare probabilistic training approaches (VI vs. MCD vs. SNGP), evaluate prediction performance (ranking + time-to-event accuracy), evaluate calibration performance (distribution, coverage, probability calibration), provide computational efficiency comparisons.
Metrics Used: Antolini CI, IBS (IPCW), MAE-H, MAE-PO, D-Cal, C-Cal
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, uses the appropriate metrics for ranking, time-to-event prediction, and calibration.

Year / Title: SYNDSURV: A simple framework for survival analysis with data distributed across multiple institutions
Objectives / Goals: Distributed synthetic-data survival modeling; claims TTE prediction
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, no calibration, incomplete censoring evaluation

Year / Title: Survival-LCS: A Rule-Based Machine Learning Approach to Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict survival times, predict full survival distributions, handle censoring with novel error and accuracy updates, detect complex genetic associations (epistasis, heterogeneity), provide interpretable rule-based models, perform well across varying censoring proportions, feature dimension, and interaction structure.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, missing calibration, missing ranking, incomplete censoring evaluation

Year / Title:
Using Geographic Location-based Public Health Features in
Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Determine whether adding geographic location-based public health features improves survival prediction quality, evaluate on SEER data using existing models (CoxPH, DSM), prediction goal is framed strictly in terms of agreement between predicted and observed survival times, quantified by C-index (ranking), no claims about predicting time-to-event, calibration, or distribution accuracy.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, no distributional or censoring-related claims.

Year / Title: Survival analysis in breast cancer: evaluating ensemble learning techniques for prediction
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-relapse in breast cancer, compare the predictive ability of CoxPH vs. RSF vs. CForest, evaluate model discrimination and prediction error, provide variable importance explanations, illustrate survival probability curves for hypothetical patients
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics and censoring assumptions not addressed

Year / Title: Deep Survival Analysis With Latent Clustering and Contrastive Learning
Objectives / Goals: Improve survival prediction accuracy, improve risk discrimination, improve calibration, handle censored data more effectively via contrastive learning, provide better patient-level survival curves (CIF)
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE error metrics; incomplete calibration, censoring mechanism not addressed; Harrell CI used without justification

Year / Title: Fairness in Survival Analysis with Distributionally Robust Optimization
Objectives / Goals: Improve fairness across all sufficiently large subpopulations using a DRO-based method, be applicable to any survival model, including Cox, DeepHit, SODEN, maintain accuracy (discrimination & risk prediction quality), handle censoring within fairness metrics.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, metrics match stated goals and censoring handled appropriately

Year / Title: Deep Contrastive Survival Analysis with Dual-View Clustering
Objectives / Goals: Improve survival prediction performance for glioma patients, predict survival risk / rank patients, produce more accurate survival curves (they include predicted KM-like curves), compare their model to baseline models on multiple metrics.
Metrics Used: C-index, AUC, Accuracy, F1, KM curves
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing calibration & survival-curve accuracy. Harrell CI without assumptions; no IPCW metrics; classification metrics invalid under censoring

Year / Title: Leveraging the variational Bayes autoencoder for survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict the full time-to-event distribution analytically, estimate survival functions and hazard functions for individual patients, handle censored data correctly within likelihood training, provide good risk discrimination, provide good survival-curve accuracy (IBS), demonstrate competitive performance vs Cox, DeepSurv, DeepHit.
Metrics Used: Antolin CI, IBS, MRR (Mean Reciprocal Rank), p-values for CI/IBS
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, they claim to predict the time-to-event distribution, yet no MAE/RMSE/TTE metric is reported. Censoring is handled well, but assumptions are not stated

Year / Title: Survival Analysis of Superficial Bladder Cancer patients using DeepSurv and Cox models
Objectives / Goals: Predict risk ranking for bladder cancer patients, rank patients by risk, provide treatment recommendations using hazard ratios/log risk differences, evaluate predictive performance of DeepMLPSurv vs Cox and other models, analyze tumor recurrence based on features.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, censoring assumptions are not addressed, and censoring-robust metrics are missing.

Year / Title: A Genetic Algorithm-based Auto-ML System for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event outcomes, cope with censored data, automatically select the best survival model + hyperparameters, improve predictive accuracy over baseline methods, evaluate performance across multiple datasets
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics and censoring assumptions not addressed

Year / Title: Transformer-based time-to-event prediction for chronic kidney disease deterioration
Objectives / Goals: Predict exact time-to-event (time to deterioration to CKD Stage 5), improve MAE vs. baseline TTE models (explicit claim), predict full survival curves, handle censored data correctly, enable ranking and risk stratification, enable clinical interpretability
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match some objectives (MAE for TTE accuracy, C-index for ranking), but censoring assumptions are not validated, and censoring-robust metrics are missing.

Year / Title: Prioritising deteriorating patients using time-to-event analysis: prediction model development and internal–external validation
Objectives / Goals: Use a Cox time-to-event model to improve ranking of patients by risk, compare ranking performance of Cox vs discrete-time logistic regression, develop a model useful for triage prioritization
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, only concerned with ranking, Uno’s AUC handles censoring properly.

Year / Title: Conformalized Survival Distributions: A Generic Post-Process to Increase Calibration
Objectives / Goals: Improve calibration of individual survival distributions (D-cal, KM-cal), preserve discrimination (C-index), handle censoring correctly in a conformal-regression setting
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, D-Cal, KM-Cal, IBS, MAE-PO
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, they claim to address discrimination and calibration and evaluate both thoroughly, censoring assumptions stated and handled

Year / Title: An Integrated Uncertainty Quantification Model for Longitudinal and Time-to-Event Data
Objectives / Goals: Jointly model longitudinal + TTE data; propagate uncertainty from both sources; improve risk prediction accuracy; quantify prediction uncertainty
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, MAE (uncensored), RMSE, interval coverage metrics, uncertainty width/coverage diagnostics
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics cover TTE accuracy but not calibration; censoring assumptions not addressed; no formal calibration test

Year / Title: An Evidential Time-to-Event Prediction Model Based on Gaussian Random Fuzzy Numbers
Objectives / Goals: Predict continuous time-to-event values, quantify uncertainty using belief functions & random fuzzy numbers, handle right censoring correctly via modified evidential likelihood, achieve good predictive performance, achieve good calibration
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, missing TTE accuracy metrics; censoring assumptions unstated

Year / Title: New Dynamic Bayesian Network for Time-to-Event Prediction
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event outcomes (disease progression, relapse, etc.), compare DBN performance against existing survival models, emphasize ranking / discrimination ability.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, wrong metrics for the stated objective (time-to-event), incorrect handling of censoring

Year / Title: Development and validation of time-to-event models to predict metastatic recurrence of localized cutaneous melanoma
Objectives / Goals: Develop time-to-event risk prediction models for melanoma metastatic recurrence, identify patients “at the highest risk of distant recurrence, who are therefore most likely to benefit from adjuvant therapy, focus on the methodological approach to time-to-event prediction
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match their time-to-event risk prediction goal, but paper does not address if they are using IPCW or another correction technique for censoring.

Year / Title: The AccelerAge framework: a new statistical approach to predict biological age based on time-to-event data
Objectives / Goals: Predict residual life (survival time) via AFT models, convert residual life into predicted biological age, evaluate biological age clocks using discrimination and calibratrion metrics
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match the goals of time-to-event biological age predictors, but they never state censoring assumptions (independent censoring), even though Uno C requires them; and calibration is performed on observed mortality without censoring adjustment.

Year / Title: Improving credit risk assessment in P2P lending with explainable machine learning survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Estimate hazard ratios and then assign borrowers into risk-rating groups, evaluate whether ratings separate default risk, IRR, and survival curves.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match the goals of risk prediction, but they never establish censoring assumptions, never check censoring mechanisms, and use biased metrics (Harrell) as primary indicators.

Year / Title: Stable Cox regression for survival analysis under distribution shifts
Objectives / Goals: Build a stable Cox model that improves generalization of risk ranking under distribution shifts, identify stable variables that maintain predictive value across cohorts, evaluate prognostic performance on real-world cancer datasets
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match the goals of risk prediction, but they use C-index without specifying estimator; no IPCW; no censoring assumptions; KM/log-rank assumptions unaddressed.

Year / Title: Leveraging the variational Bayes autoencoder for survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Estimate the full predictive distribution of time-to-event, handle right-censored data, compare survival models using standard survival metrics
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics. They measure only ranking (C-index) and global IBS. No censoring assumptions stated and Antolini CI is biased under random censoring; high censoring rates unaddressed

Year / Title: Collaborative Survival Analysis on Predicting Alzheimer’s Disease Progression
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event outcomes, specifically time to Alzheimer’s Disease onset, show improved time-to-event prediction when combining modalities
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match the stated TTE objective, and censoring handling is insufficient (Harrell C, no censoring assumptions, no IPCW)

Year / Title: Interactive Explainable Deep Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event (specifically time to death); estimate individualized survival curves; predict survival time “as close as possible” to true time; integrate explainability for understanding factors influencing survival time; support clinical time-dependent decision-making.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective, censoring handling is incorrect for chosen metric.

Year / Title: CoxFNN: Interpretable machine learning method for survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict time-to-event outcomes using a non-linear Cox extension; model intends to capture non-linear relationships in hazard while also providing interpretable rules; authors state goal of predicting time until an event occurs and emphasize learning hazards, survival function, and membership thresholds that reflect when patients are at high risk; aims to balance predictive performance with interpretability.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective, censoring handling is incorrect for chosen metric.

Year / Title: Predicting Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Progression: an EMG-based Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict disease progression in ALS using EMG-derived metrics, predict survival outcomes (i.e., event occurrence) in ALS, predict survival time (time-to-event), model evolution of ALS over time and generate survival curves to support patient follow-up.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective, censoring handling is incorrect for chosen metric.

Year / Title: Deep Gated Neural Network With Self-Attention Mechanism for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Model the time distributions of the first occurrences of events of interest, estimate the probability mass function (PMF) of the first hitting time
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, TTE objective is only partially evaluated (MAE only on uncensored cases), censoring is not correctly handled as Antolini CI is biased under random censoring

Year / Title: Towards Robust Time-to-Event Prediction: Integrating the Variational Information Bottleneck with Neural Survival Model
Objectives / Goals: Predict the actual time-to-event (event-time) distribution, estimate survival density and survival function, improve accuracy of time-to-event estimation under noise.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective, metrics used are not censoring-robust

Year / Title: Interpretable machine learning for time-to-event prediction in medicine and healthcare
Objectives / Goals:
Introduce time-dependent interpretability methods for survival analysis, demonstrate the usefulness of these interpretability tools on:
Hospital Length of Stay (LoS) modeled as a time-to-event prediction problem, and Cancer survival prediction using TCGA multi-omics data
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective (no MAE/MSE/RMSE) or calibration, censoring handling is incorrect for chosen metric.

Year / Title: Cohort-Individual Cooperative Learning for Multimodal Cancer Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Risk ranking in cancer prognosis; Improve discrimination and generalization of multimodal survival models
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, metrics match ranking objective, but censoring not properly handled (no use of IPCW)

Year / Title: Comparative analysis and interpretability of survival models for melanoma prognosis
Objectives / Goals: Evaluate and compare survival analysis models for melanoma prognosis, predict survival outcomes (OS, SS, DFS) for melanoma, assess both predictive performance and interpretability.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, they use correct metrics for their ranking + calibration objectives, but censoring not properly handled (no use of IPCW)

Year / Title: Explainable transformer-based deep survival analysis in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia
Objectives / Goals: Predict patient-specific survival probabilities over time, model survival curves (S(t)) and hazard functions, assess model discrimination (ranking), provide interpretability (SHAP).
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, they predict survival probabilities, but use only C-index. They do not use any censoring-corrected metrics (Uno CI, IPCW AUC, IBS).

Year / Title: An MRI-based deep learning radiomics model predicts recurrence-free survival in lung cancer patients after surgical resection of brain metastases
Objectives / Goals: Predict RFS, a time-to-event outcome (RFS = time from surgery to recurrence/death), predict intracranial recurrence at fixed horizons (6, 12, 18 months), risk stratification using survival curves, construct a prognostic nomogram
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, metrics do not match TTE objective, censoring handling is incorrect for chosen metric.

Year / Title: TDMFS: Tucker decomposition multimodal fusion model for pan-cancer survival prediction
Objectives / Goals: Develop a new multimodal survival model (TDMFS) using Tucker decomposition, improve survival prediction accuracy (i.e., risk prediction, not explicit time-to-event estimation), perform risk stratification with Kaplan–Meier curves to show separation of high- vs. low-risk groups.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, proper metrics for risk ranking, but censoring handled poorly; no calibration; not suitable for true time-to-event evaluation.

Year / Title: Time-dependent interpretable survival prediction model for second primary NSCLC patients
Objectives / Goals: Develop and validate machine-learning-based survival prediction models for overall survival (OS) in SP-NSCLC, predict survival probabilities over time, evaluate time-dependent predictor importance via permutation explanation, risk stratification into high- and low-risk groups via KM curves.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, they use correct metrics (CI, tdAUC) for ranking, but metrics (CI) are biased under censoring

Year / Title: Model averaging prediction for survival data with time-dependent effects
Objectives / Goals: Develop a model-averaging method for Cox models with time-varying covariate effects, improve prediction of survival outcomes when the true model structure is unknown or partially misspecified, provide theoretical justification (asymptotic optimality) and demonstrate predictive performance via simulations and real data.
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, main metrics match objectives; censoring handled via IPCW.

Year / Title: Adaptive transformer modelling of density function for nonparametric survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict the full time-to-event distribution via a PDF and survival function S(t), improve prediction of survival time via modeling mean lifetime, accurately predict censoring via novel loss terms, handle static + dynamic (longitudinal) covariates.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, evaluation does not match the claims and censoring is not fully addressed for distribution-quality assessment.

Year / Title: CoxKAN: Kolmogorov-Arnold networks for interpretable, high-performance survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict log-partial hazard (risk ranking), recover symbolic formulae representing hazard contributions, automatic feature pruning using KAN structure..
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, they use correct metric for risk ranking, but censoring not handled correctly

Year / Title: Integrating images and genomics for multi-modal cancer survival analysis via mixture of experts
Objectives / Goals: Develop a multimodal framework (MoE + cross-modal attention) to predict survival risk, improve integration of WSI features and pathway-based genomic features, achieve better risk stratification and prognostic discrimination across TCGA cancers.

Year / Title: Integrating Copula-Based Random Forest and Deep Learning Approaches for Analyzing Heterogeneous Treatment Effects in Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict survival outcomes (vital status), estimate Heterogeneous Treatment Effects (HTE), evaluate differences in treatment effects across race, improve prediction with HT and IPTW weighting
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, no survival metrics and censoring is ignored, mismatch between stated goals and evaluation

Year / Title: Comparative study of five-year cervical cancer cause-specific survival prediction models based on SEER data
Objectives / Goals: Predict 5-year cause-specific survival (CSS) for cervical cancer patients, compare five survival models, identify important clinical predictors of CSS using SHAP, provide risk stratification (KM curves + log-rank test).
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, metrics match objectives, censoring handled correctly

Year / Title: Transformer-based dynamic survival probability prediction for longitudinal observational data
Objectives / Goals: Predict survival probabilities dynamically over time, model longitudinal measurements, improve prediction accuracy over existing longitudinal survival models, interpretability via SHAP
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, no censoring assumptions stated; metric is biased

Year / Title: MENSA: A Multi-Event Network for Survival Analysis with Trajectory-based Likelihood Estimation
Objectives / Goals: Model multiple time-to-event distributions jointly, improve event ordering (local survival discrimination), improve global discrimination, provide population survival curves

Year / Title: A meaningful prediction of functional decline in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis based on multi-event survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Predict functional decline as an event in ALS patients, perform risk ranking, make counterfactual predictions
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, Uno CI, IBS, mMAE, D-Cal

Year / Title: Deep learning models for the analysis of high-dimensional survival data with time-varying covariates while handling missing data
Objectives / Goals: Apply survival models to predict time to HIV infection using high-dimensional data with time-varying cytokines
Metrics Match Objectives?: Yes, metrics fully appropriate and no misuse of censorship assumptions.

Year / Title: Alzheimer’s disease risk prediction using machine learning for survival analysis with a comorbidity-based approach
Objectives / Goals: Predict time to conversion from CN to MCI, predict risk prediction / progression modelling, and clinical usefulness (risk stratification, early detection, etc.
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, heavy censoring with unadjusted Harrell's CI and no discussion of assumptions

Year / Title: A machine learning approach for multimodal data fusion for survival prediction in cancer patients
Objectives / Goals: Compare multimodal vs unimodal survival models for overall survival (OS) on TCGA; main focus on improved discrimination / predictive performance and multimodal fusion strategy (late fusion)
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, they use correct metric for risk ranking and acknowledges censoring-induced bias, but still uses a censoring-biased metric (Harrell's CI)

Year / Title: Reliable multimodal cancer survival prediction with confidence-aware risk modeling
Objectives / Goals: Improve risk prediction for cancer survival, provide reliable risk predictions via confidence-aware modeling, improve multimodal fusion through cross-modal alignment
Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, CI is the correct metric for ranking, but they use plain Harrell CI under heavy censoring with no IPCW

Year / Title: Beyond Cox models: Assessing the performance of machine-learning methods in non-proportional hazards and non-linear survival analysis
Objectives / Goals: Evaluate predictive performance of survival methods under PH / non-PH / linear / nonlinear conditions, compare survival metrics and show when Harrell CI is inappropriate, assess calibration, study sample-size effects and computational cost.

Metrics Match Objectives?: Partially, strong metric alignment with goals, but fails censoring-handling criterion as they do not correct for censoring (eg, IPCW)

Year / Title: KSP: Kolmogorov-Smirnov metric-based Post-Hoc Calibration for Survival Analysis
Objectives / Goals: Develop a new calibration method for survival models (KSP), improve calibration across the entire survival distribution without harming discrimination, provide theoretical foundations for KS-cal and show consistency, empirically evaluate calibration performance across datasets and survival models
Metrics Used: Harrell CI, D-cal, KS-cal, KM-cal, IBS

Year / Title: Deep Kernel Aalen-Johansen Estimator: An Interpretable and Flexible Neural Net Framework for Competing Risks
Objectives / Goals: Predict cumulative incidence functions (CIFs) for competing risks at the individual level, make interpretable predictions, provide a flexible neural estimator generalizing Aalen-Johansen.

Year / Title: Ensemble survival analysis for preclinical cognitive decline prediction in Alzheimer's disease using longitudinal biomarkers
Objectives / Goals: Predict the time to clinical progression from CN to MCI/AD, early risk stratification using longitudinal biomarkers
Metrics Match Objectives?: No, missing TTE metrics, censoring bias not addressed

Year / Title: Forecasting time to risk based on multi-party data: An explainable privacy-preserving decentralized survival analysis method
Objectives / Goals: Forecast when a financial risk event will occur in a decentralized, privacy-preserving setting, provide explainability, via time-dependent coefficients across forecasting horizons.
